name: overmedicated
text: A comment left by overmedicated was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by JimTS, NeoNaoNeo, erincandy, Sweetlips, luckypyjamas, kickstart, sumisueme, Darthemed)

name: catachresis
text:
I was so close to pulling this move the other night

Stupid gravel floor

name: a_dude
text: T's got hella moves

name: rational
text: Agreed. I had to see what it really looked like...

name: anomalous3
text: it is impossible to give this comment as many chubbies as it deserves

name: semiquaver
text: The fact that you bothered to chop the "T" off "THOP" to make the little dotted-line "HOP" makes you a marvel.

name: straw
text: O my goodness gracious.

name: straw
text: Also, cue up Common - The Corner and watch this gif for a while.

name: aki
text:
That's really remarkable, he pumps his arms, strikes the pose and even hops in time, this is a connection so very removed in degrees but so very very appropriate.
"We write songs about wrong cause it's hard to see right; Look to the sky hoping it will bleed light"

name: hipjiverobot
text: You are a true American hero

name: mercuri0us
text: Your avatar is almost as good as this animation.  Bravo.

name: william
text: I love the crossed arms at the end.  Teodor is so hard.

name: hellofyellin
text: Thop.

name: satellitetv
text: It's the B-boy stance, look at some old Run D.M.C. photos

name: scorpio_nadir
text: I find myself using this move at least once a day on my friends now.

name: delzhand
text: Dang, though, the dance move requires proximity to a wall.

name: windex
text: I don't think T�odor used a wall, he just put some back spin on his head when he bounced it.

name: blarghamagarky
text: or the edge of a panel in a comic strip

name: baryonyx
text: As well as the ability to remove your own head.

name: charchar
text: Dude...where my Fireys at?

name: jaredwilde
text: Hell of chubbies for Labyrinth reference

name: chaesar
text: Any dance move requiring the presence of a doctor is a 5 in my book.

name: vreeeee
text: Doctor Andretti takes a serious interest in the well-being not just of Beef and Ray, but also in their stuffed animal compatriots.

name: onepapertiger
text: Thank you for putting this into The Right Words

name: hollis
text: Like Roast Beef, Ray is upset when people do not show up to eat his cooking: http://achewood.com/index.php?date=01172007

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: A comment left by jujubeesforjesus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by GSurge, rachel, sexualhomeboy)

name: tombsgrave
text: This is the kind of dance move they put in video games where the entire point is that your character is the biggest badass in the tri-state area, bar none.  This belongs in God of War, or Godhand, or God Sudoku: Dismemberment Incident.

name: divot
text: The look on T's face completely makes this. He is angry at this dance move, and he will beat it into submission.

name: yaegmenthor
text: It is the angriest a person can be, to do this.

name: professorhazard
text: DO YOU WANT SOME FRITTATA?

name: crankheart
text: i just had a 'goats' flashback...

name: terrainasaur
text: it's the rude disposition of the orezcu that propels this strip from "good" to "sweet jesus how can anything be this incredible."

name: hendetta
text: Hell of head removal, yo.

name: jesler729
text:
I just love the

tiny little hop he does beforehand.

name: tttt
text: how could one tear one's head off without it

name: peterjoel
text: Also, being a stuffed toy helps. The actual clever part is how he bounces off the floor and back into place.

name: jesler729
text: Bounces it off the floor and the back of the Teodor in front of him.

name: baryonyx
text: This move requires seven Teodors to pull off, three of which must be expendable.

name: laserblade
text: I was gonna lame this comment for being nonsense, but then I looked up at the strip and realized it was a profound meditation on the comix medium.  Scott McCloud should give you a medal.

name: mrblank91
text: Holy crap! A miniture chicken.

name: twohundredninety
text: Maybe it's a Cornish game hen?

name: godfatherofsouls
text: You... You cut 'em up, just like regular chickens.

name: honesttom
text: My first Achewood!

name: reverendsam
text: this dance move raises really difficult questions

name: rowboat
text: A comment left by rowboat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Overmedicated, orvel, pr0ncess)

name: drskradley
text: I'm assuming it's similar to Duck A L'Orange . (also)

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Definitely real. Wouldn't have an overpowering citrus flavor, just a nice light one if done right.

name: zem
text:
what's wrong with you
citrus and chicken are perfect together

name: pr0ncess
text: accidental lame dude. I wanted to chubby you because I agree whole-heartedly that citrus and chicken are perfect together! sorry :(

name: zem
text: i can't believe you've done this

name: mr_lostman28
text:
Hey Citrus, hey chicken, I love it when you touch each other.
(please tell me there's someone who gets this)

name: hellofyellin
text: Man, brining is by far the best thing you can do to a chicken before you cook it.  It seasons deeper and more evenly than any simple rubbing of salt and spices can do, and it keeps the white meat moist throughout the cooking while allowing the skin to brown.  And the citrus flavor would add a delicious and subtle layer.  Check out Alton Brown's Turkey brine. Maybe, if you're good, I'll find  a link for you.

name: hellofyellin
text: Convert, infidel.

name: rowboat
text: Well, I guess I was imagining the citrus taste to be sort of oppressive or over-the-top.  If it's only hinted at, I can see how it might be nice.  But here's just something about that tired old salt rub that seems so right. Don't think low of me. In the end, I just don't really like...meals.

name: rowboat
text: Ahem: "THERE'S" just something...

name: hellofyellin
text: I would never think low of you, my man.

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
And in the end, we all became better people.

Citrus-brined chicken and totally-rude dance moves have a way of doing that, I guess.

name: hellofyellin
text:
And all throughout Whoville, there was peace in the land,
With rowboat, hellofyellin and zem hand in hand,
With happiest thoughts, the whole group did sing,

Citrus-Brined Chicken was officially a Thing.

name: zem
text: i'm in it, chubbied

name: rowboat
text:
Just to put a nice ribbon on this whole thread - I have since eaten citrus brined chicken and it was great.

THE END

name: irondave
text:
I'm surprised no one has posted this tune, and I'll be more surprised if Assetbar doesn't farkle the link:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GOjMR_09D3M

name: wilbur
text: Holy crap! Nice find, man. Dress up T in pink ribbons and put him in a kitchenette.

name: sevenslashfour
text: More surprising than Teodor's head coming off, is that Beef is wearing a shirt.
